extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Unenclosed Porches

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Enclosed porches, recessed porches, and other specified porch types.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF porch is unenclosed THEN its area is not counted towards the total floor area.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for 'Enclosed porches'.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Enclosed Porches

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF porch is enclosed THEN its area is counted once towards the total floor area.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for 'Unenclosed porches'.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Low-Height Entry Features

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to entry features with a height of 12 feet or less.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF entry feature height is ≤ 12' THEN its area is not counted.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for entry features > 12' in height.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for High-Height Entry Features

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to entry features with a height greater than 12 feet.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Entry features 12 feet or less in height.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF entry feature height is > 12' THEN its footprint area is counted twice.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for entry features ≤ 12' in height.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for 1st Floor Recessed Porches

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to recessed porches on the 1st floor that are open on an exterior side and have a limited depth.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Porches on other floors, enclosed porches, or porches deeper than the specified limit.

Variables.Dimensional: Depth of the porch, Floor level.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (floor level is 1st) AND (depth is < 10') AND (porch is open on an exterior side) THEN its area is not counted.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for 2nd Floor Roofed or Enclosed Features

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to 2nd floor roofed or enclosed porches, arcades, balconies, porticos, and breezeways.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Features on other floors; features not listed.

Variables.Usage: Feature type (porch, arcade, balcony, portico, breezeway), Enclosure status (roofed or enclosed).

Conditions.Mandatory: Feature must be on the 2nd floor and be one of the specified types (porch, arcade, etc.) and be roofed or enclosed.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (floor level is 2nd) AND (feature type is in list) AND (feature is roofed or enclosed) THEN its area is counted once.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Low-Height Attic Space

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to attic space where the vertical distance from the floor to the underside of the roof rafter is 5 feet or less.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Attic space with a height greater than 5 feet.

Variables.Dimensional: Height from floor to underside of roof rafter.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF attic height (floor to rafter) is ≤ 5' THEN its area is not counted.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Mutually exclusive with the rule for 2nd floor space where height is ≥ 5'.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Standard 2nd Floor Space and Attics

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to all 2nd floor space, including attics, where head height is 5 feet or greater.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Space with head height less than 5 feet.

Variables.Dimensional: Head height (top of floor to bottom of rafter), Floor level.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (floor level is 2nd) AND (head height is ≥ 5') THEN its area is counted once.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Mutually exclusive with the rule for low-height attic space.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for 2nd Floor Equivalent (High Volume)

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area, with penalties for high-volume spaces.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to areas where the height from the top of the first floor to the top of the roof material is greater than 17 feet.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Areas where this height is ≤ 17 feet or ≥ 26 feet.

Variables.Dimensional: Height from top of first floor to top of roof material.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF height from top of 1st floor to top of roof is > 17' (and < 26') THEN the area is counted twice.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Part of a tiered system with the '3rd floor equivalent' rule.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for 3rd Floor Equivalent (Very High Volume)

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area, with penalties for very high-volume spaces.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to areas where the height from the top of the first floor to the top of the roof material is 26 feet or greater.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Areas where this height is < 26 feet.

Variables.Dimensional: Height from top of first floor to top of roof material.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF height from top of 1st floor to top of roof is ≥ 26' THEN the area is counted three times.

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: Two exemptions apply to this rule regarding roof pitch and historic homes.

Relationships.Hierarchical: Parent Category: Attics & equivalencies. This rule has two child exception rules.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Highest tier of the high-volume space calculation.

extracted_rules.rule: Exemption to 3rd Floor Equivalent for Steep Roof Pitch

Qualifiers.Scope: Provides a partial exemption from the '3rd floor equivalent' calculation.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to areas subject to the '3rd floor equivalent' rule where the roof pitch is 4:12 or greater.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Roofs with a pitch less than 4:12.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (area is subject to 3rd floor equivalent rule) AND (roof pitch is ≥ 4:12) THEN 200 sf of that area is exempt from the calculation.
Conditions.Dependencies: Depends on the '3rd Floor Equivalent' rule being triggered.

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: This is an explicit deviation from the parent rule.

Relationships.Hierarchical: Child exception to the '3rd Floor Equivalent' rule.

extracted_rules.rule: Exemption for Unusable Attic in Historic Homes

Qualifiers.Scope: Provides a partial exemption for unusable attic space in historic homes.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to unusable attic space in Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (home is Category 1 or 2 historic) AND (attic space is unusable) THEN 500 sf is exempt.
Conditions.Dependencies: Applies in the context of the '3rd floor equivalent' calculation.

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: This is an explicit deviation from the parent rule.
Exceptions.Special Cases: Flagged Ambiguous Language: The text links this to the '3rd floor equivalent' rule, but it could potentially be a general exemption. The current interpretation is that it's an exception to the 3rd floor equivalent rule only.

Relationships.Hierarchical: Child exception to the '3rd Floor Equivalent' rule.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Compliant Basements

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to basements that comply with specific patio and lightwell requirements.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Basements not in compliance with the specified regulation.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF basement complies with requirements of 18.12.070 THEN its area is not counted.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Basements in Historic Structures

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district.

Variables.Material: Historic Home Category (1 or 2), Contributing structure status.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (home is Category 1 or 2 historic) OR (structure is a contributing structure in a historic district) THEN its basement area is not counted.
Conditions.Dependencies: Flagged Ambiguous Language: The phrase '(even if > 3')' implies this rule overrides another unstated rule about basement height, likely related to a 3-foot threshold.

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: This rule serves as an exception to a more general, unstated rule about basements.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Overrides a general basement calculation rule that is not present in the text.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Bay Windows

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to bay windows that meet a specific set of dimensional and material criteria.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Bay windows that fail to meet any one of the specified criteria.

Variables.Dimensional: Height above interior floor, Projection distance from wall.
Variables.Material: Percentage of the bay window's surface that is windows.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (height above floor ≥ 18") AND (projection ≤ 2') AND (window area > 50%) THEN its area is not counted.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Architectural Appendages

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to the footprint of architectural appendages such as fireplaces or buttresses.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Appendages not explicitly listed or similar.

Conditions.Mandatory: The footprint of a fireplace or buttress is counted once.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Large Accessory Structures

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to accessory structures with a floor area greater than 120 square feet.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Accessory structures ≤ 120 sf, Garages, carports, porte cocheres.

Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF accessory structure area is > 120 sf THEN its area is counted once.

Relationships.Logical Dependencies: An implied rule exists for structures ≤ 120 sf (which presumably do not count).

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Garages and Carports

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Other types of accessory structures like porte cocheres or general sheds.

Conditions.Mandatory: The area of a garage or carport is counted once.

extracted_rules.rule: Floor Area Calculation for Porte Cocheres

Qualifiers.Scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Garages, carports, and other accessory structures.

Conditions.Mandatory: The area of a porte cochere is not counted.
